member_organisations:
The Federation currently represents 53 national, regional or international member associations. There are currently three Associate Partners. The full list of members can be found here: 
 
http://wfsj.org/v2/associations-partners/
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Youth, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Communication
eu_initiatives:
Project for Sharing and Growing Nuclear Safety Competence (NUSHARE) 
Taking stock and re-examining the role of science communication
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
The World Federation of Science Journalists (WFSJ) is a not-for-profit, non-governmental organisation, representing 52 science journalists’ associations of science and technology journalists from Africa, the Americas, the Asia-Pacific, Europe and the Middle East. The Federation encourages strong, critical coverage of issues in science and technology, environment, health and medicine, agriculture and related fields. 
 
The WFSJ seeks to further science journalism as a bridge between science, scientists and the public. It promotes the role of science journalists as key players in civil society and democracy. The Federation’s goals are to improve the quality of science reporting, promote standards and support science and technology journalists worldwide.
relevant_communication: Subcontractor of Project for Sharing and Growing Nuclear Safety Competence (NUSHARE): Organize workshop for journalists about covering nuclear safety, develop a website  with toolbox for journalists
